channel.title: Weird compiler thing
channel.description:
alright well YES i have jdk, and stuff, and the compiler does "techinclly" work. thing is it doesnt. i have over 2 months now of coding, the really needs to be put to life. the compiler doesnt do its job with the client.java file. i tird a bunch of diffrent compilers so far what i have is that looks like it works is
[code]@echo off title Easy Compiler V1 echo Please Wait... if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :end pause exit[/code]
the two and three line ones dont work for me. anyway i appreciate any help with this im not sure what to do.

item.title: Weird compiler thing
item.dc:creator: @jb_blaze jb blaze
item.description:
@jb_blaze wrote:

alright well YES i have jdk, and stuff, and the compiler does “techinclly” work.
thing is it doesnt. i have over 2 months now of coding, the really needs to be put to life.
the compiler doesnt do its job with the client.java file. i tird a bunch of diffrent compilers so far what i have is that looks like it works is

@echo off title Easy Compiler V1 echo Please Wait... if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :end pause exit

the two and three line ones dont work for me. anyway i appreciate any help with this im not sure what to do.
